reviewText: Wow! Where do I begin? There is so much material here in 2 discs. "Black Symphony" was the first DVD I owned of WT since I didn't have a multi-region player at the time. Disc 1 has the main concert at Java Island, Netherlands with 18 tracks performed running at 1 hr and 20 mins, give or take. An excellent concert performance by WT, all material on this DVD is in full screen but the main concert has the option of 5.1 surround sound. The Java Island concert is performed outside so you get to see the amazing atmosphere surrounded by water and ships passing by. The concert starts during the day where you see everything in view then slowly the night comes in during the show where you get the great show of the pyrotechnics. On the same disc is 2 mini performances at Finland and Belgium with 3 tracks performed on each. Then you get 3 videos from "The Silent Force" album (Stand My Ground, Angels, Memories). Disc 2 you get all the extra goodies of behind the scenes of concerts and on the road, radio and television interviews, fan interactions with meet and greets, and a whole lotta HOT Sharon Den Adel! This is a must have for any WT, gothic, and symphonic metal fan out there!

reviewText: Bored with most current rock, I entered the world of Goth Rock throughEvanescence, then Nightwish, Leave's Eyes and now these folks.Within Temptation has a great band, but and incredible singer (which isnormal for most Goth Rock bands) This captures the group at theirearlier phase, and is very good. If you don't have their most recent live show "Black Symphony" you are really missing some great music.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Great to see many of my favourite songs performed live and with such effect.  Also includes the music videos to 3 of their songs, their 'Angels' and 'Memories' like mini movies.  Some of the Bloopers just consisted of giggling for what seemed like a long time but also included footage of one band member saving another from an on stage effect - awesome.  Overall a great DVD that is going to get a lot of play in my household.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Great sound....Lots of choices.  If you are more into the music use any of the multi-channel settings.  For some reason, I hear Sharonbetter on a stereo setting in both of my WITHIN TEMPTATION videos  (one Blu-ray, one DVD).  Don't know if it is my equipment or the recordings.  All sound settings sound great, though.  The video is a recording of a concert, so it is not like a music video.The group's performance is still captivating.The disc is PAL encoded so if you only have an NTSC machine you will not be able to use it.Can't wait until my MOTHER EARTH concert DVD arrives.I wrote a better review before but Amazon did not like my ****s.
summary: Sharon den Adel.... In both voice and appearance she's Exquisite!! Beautiful!!! Moving!!!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: It has become almost routine now for a number of band to put out a live release of some description for each tour they do. In the case of symphonic metal/symphonic rock crew Within Temptation this is the DVD of the tour of their Silent Force album which took their fortunes to a new level.Split into two discs, disc one comprises 165 minutes of footage of the band treading the boards across Europe - Netherlands, Finland and Belgium to be precise. The bulk of the footage comes from Java Island which with a nice stage, full light show etc and the interesting presence of a large cruise liner in the background of many of the camera angles certainly makes for a visually striking as well as musically excellent package. The sound quality is as good as you'd expect and the camera work is quite nice. Those fans who didn't appreciate the rapid camera angle changes of their later Black Symphony DVD may appreciate this more as there is less jumping around here and more time to enjoy the performance without constantly adjusting to the new camera angle. Extras to disc one are the music videos for Stand My Ground, Memories and Angels.Disc two is the home of the bulk of the extras. All 182 minutes of them. Again there is an air of quality about pretty much anything this band does so many of the interviews are somewhat interesting and some of the making of... sections are quite useful. Also useful are some of the little snippets of life on the road that make the band and their crew more human, if you take my meaning. The problem is however that all this backstage stuff is pretty painful stuff, much of it is stuff you are never going to want to watch again. I mean inside jokes on the bus, chatting while they are eating, sitting around in backstage areas, people getting haircuts.... you get the idea of what I'm on about here don't you? It's not really entertaining and it's a pitfall that so many bands fall into (although watching Jens Johansson blow up a toilet in the Stratovarius DVD Infinite Visions was at least mildly amusing). Disc two is salvaged a bit however by some extra concert footage as well as the abovementioned behind the scenes tidbits.But please don't let my disinterest in the minutiae of life on the road for Within Temptation dissuade you from buying this DVD. The concert stuff really is great and the indefinable X factor this band has shines through relentlessly and as a companion to the more insanely overblown (in a good way) Black Symphony DVD this is pretty much a must have item for your DVD rack if you are one of the bands fans. Dig in.
